intro: Chonemorpha splendens, commonly known as the splendour daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela, which are dispersed by wind. Chonemorpha splendens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
